topic.title: Zeronet app templates
topic.body:
Up for grabs for a designer.
I think it would be nice if there were some templates that look consistent with zeronet that we can use.
That way, even a new app can have a nice looking design, which leaves more time to play with the actual functionality and makes zeronet look better.

topic.title: App ideas list
topic.body: Post each app idea as a separate reply and let's upvote the ones we want to see built.

topic.title: How to go about importing RSS of mp3s if I wanted to make a podcast app?
topic.body: Can this even be done on client side?

topic.title: ZeroTalk improvements wishlist
topic.body: List things you'd like to improve on ZeroTalk one by one and vote for others' ideas.

topic.title: Generating a vanity address for a zite
topic.body:
Hi, I just used [vanity](https://github.com/samr7/vanitygen) to create a public and private key pair.

1) Generated the key pair
2) Created directory with vanity address
3) Cloned ZeroTalk fork in
4) Changed the `address` field in `content.json`
5) ... ?

Now there are bunch of things in `content.json` and I am wondering what to do next. 
Can you help me out please?

topic.title: How to compile the Coffeescript files?
topic.body:
There is `js/all.js` that seems to be containing `js/utils/*.js` and `js/**/*.coffee` so I need to compile and concat those.

How is this not documented on each project? Is ZN compiling it for me or something? (it doesn't seem to be though)

topic.title: Test ZeroHive (reddit like ZeroTalk fork) with me
topic.body:
Hey guys,
can I get you to check out the reddit fork I am building?

I'd like to get your feedback, start playing with it and prioritize features.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Hive8oUEeJeheQBLui2zgAxRq7hDasyEW/

1516747912_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body: Nested replies (or fork ZT for a more reddit-style project)
Archive page (so that I can go back to old posts without extreme scrolling)
Starting to play with the code, any idea on how to compile it the coffee + js files?

> [gitcenter](#comment_7_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Run zeronet with --debug option.

Thanks, that seems to do something but I ran into another issue. Any tips appreciated. http://127.0.0.1:43110/142jqssVAj2iRxMACJg2dzipB5oicZYz5w/?Topic:1517065590_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE/How+to+compile+the+Coffeescript+files

1516747933_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body: Archive page (so that I can go back to old posts without extreme scrolling)

1516748111_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body: @mentions, as a twitter user I miss them a lot
`#hashtags`, as a twitter user I miss them a lot

1516741810_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body: Lightning wallet for Bitcoin + plugin to reward creators for their content / spend BTC
Ecommerce website + aggregator with crypto support and filter for clean and not so clean items

> [jamesholden](#comment_2_12w3zJ6gRrcAw2kSCQXDkorgqxuXnkKkF8): A proper working lean reddit clone

I think forking zerotalk would be a good starting place. (its pretty and consistent design wise with other apps)

Whats missing the most (in my view):
- replies under each message
- sorting replies by upvotes
- sorting in the main window by upvotes + time decay
- subreddits (this is optional as you can have as many zerotalks as you want, if you just clone it)

If someone wants to clone [the github repo](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroTalk) I can work on that as well, as soon as I figure out how not to doxx myself immediately by commiting code.

> [pipczyk](#comment_1_1699hLXPT6n4Gr2CXnGNuMQvviZ2SZq51P): Sorry to say but ad mechanism/network. Without money zeronet will stay a curiosity

[How about donations](http://127.0.0.1:43111/1Mtby5gvNcDn3tBr3tEsrwyx2hQcVoDfXZ/?Post:2:How+can+creators+going+to+get+paid+for+their+content+on+Zeronet)? Donations incentivises creator <-> consumer relationship without third parties.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): That link isn't working for me. What site is it referring to?

Donation model based on micro-transactions for content you're consuming. Should be accessible now.

> [styromaniac](#comment_5_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I still get the connection refused error.

I am seeding it, port is open.. I'll just have to [paste it here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE_0) I guess.

1517046607_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
Wow that was fast, got reply on github:

> Actually you don't have to change anything in content.json, here is the steps:

> - Generate address using vanitygen
> - Create data/1yourvanityadress directory and copy the site file's there
> - Open http://127.0.0.1:43110/1vanityaddress in your browser
> - Open sidebar and sign all the content.json at the bottom of it.

Damn, that was easy. It just asked me for the private key and I was done.
Now I have to provide the private key to sign it, I guess there is no way to go around that right?

1517065590_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
Thanks for suggesting `--debug`, it seems to do something but not successfully. 

I was running old coffeescript, so I reinstalled everything to make sure I was running on the latest and the greated and I still get this error.

```
data/1Hive8oUEeJeheQBLui2zgAxRq7hDasyEW/js/lib/jquery.cssanim.coffee compile error: 
node.js:201
        throw e; // process.nextTick error, or 'error' event on first tick
              ^
Error: unrecognized option: --no-header
    at OptionParser.parse (/usr/lib/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/optparse.js:40:17)
    at /usr/lib/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/command.js:404:29
    at Object.run (/usr/lib/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/command.js:46:5)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/bin/coffee:3:59)
    at Module._compile (module.js:441:26)
    at Object..js (module.js:459:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:348:32)
    at Function._load (module.js:308:12)
    at Array.0 (module.js:479:10)
    at EventEmitter._tickCallback (node.js:192:41)
```

Coffeescript command says it understands `--no-header` so I wonder why it complains.
Okay turns out it wasn't compiling yet, it was the old file that had these issues. Now it just throws a bunch of compilation errors from the coffee files, which I can deal with. Thanks for the help!

1517087760_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1.body:
Damn, I have to expose the fiels somehow, I am developing on a different ZeroNet instance.
Please follow this thread, I'll post an update when I get it working. Thanks!
Looks like its running, can you try the url now and let me know if it worked?

Thanks for testing it, I'll be playing with it tomorrow. 
If you can spot my mistake in the code, let me know: https://github.com/DataCourier/ZeroTalk/tree/feat-reddit-like

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_8_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Currently in TorBrowser, when i open topic "Testing deploy", it took numerous seconds to open and i do not see a scroll bar on page, yet the page has content below the fold.

Yep there was an issue because ZeroTalk used integer ids and those were not unique. I changed it to unique string Ids so now it will be fine.
Updated, can I get you to test it out a little? We can start tracking updates there I think.

> [gitcenter](#comment_11_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Looks wonderful!

I could still use some guidance on what to commit to repo / when so that I don't have to commit the data there and keep it clean, but so far happy with the result this week. 

Can I get some comments on the [roadmap here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Hive8oUEeJeheQBLui2zgAxRq7hDasyEW/?Topic:1517145802_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE/Roadmap)?

> [gitcenter](#comment_12_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): applyTopicData

Maybe I needed to re-publish it or something.. let me know if its working now.

> [gitcenter](#comment_14_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Still nothing. Looks like that post doesn't exist at all.

Re-published the content and cleaned up the data from content.json now. Can you retry?

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Hive8oUEeJeheQBLui2zgAxRq7hDasyEW/?Topic:1517147653_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE/Roadmap

> [gitcenter](#comment_15_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Is 1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE your ID?

Its typed in identity address in the sidebar, but I have no clue if its correct/mine or not.

> [gitcenter](#comment_16_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Yeah, it's yours then. My client says that file data/users/1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE/data.json is missing. Sign&publish data/users/1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE/content.json from sidebar please.

Damn, I think I might have broken publishing content. I don't have that file either since I am editing from one directory (vagrant) and publishing from another. I've removed the data files form git but I think it also wiped them out.

Don't have a good hang of whats right to do and whats not yet in terms of file management yet.

When I try publishing, it says 0/5 peers, not sure why since someone should have it I think.

> [styromaniac](#comment_9_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Sometimes in editing mode, having the phone in portrait doesn't allow you to access all or sometimes any of the buttons Cancel, Delete and Submit. This is also a ZeroTalk bug that I never complained about since I can simply rotate to landscape.

I think I'll just let the user edit their comment in the new comment box or do something to make it work at some point. Now I need to get the hang of the file management, which I am not making progress at since it says no peers. Any ideas?

> [gitcenter](#comment_20_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Add data directory to .gitignore.

I did, which removed the files (I could do rm --cached in one directory but the other directory's data, where I publish from, was wiped).

> [gitcenter](#comment_22_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): You should never rm --cached.

Any tips on why I cannot publish the site any longer?
I can no longer publish the content, do you know of someone who might be able to help with this?

> [gitcenter](#comment_23_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): I know. Ask @gitcenter. [...]

Thanks! I'll try that in the evening and let you know how it goes.

> [gitcenter](#comment_24_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Okay. I think that will help you because it helped me.

I still can't publish a new topic or comments. I don't see any errors any longer though. Any ideas?

> [mnemonic](#comment_35_1AnFGL613gYqFWm4Lhwdk6x5gCRe1tPFxE): I still can't publish a new topic or comments. I don't see any errors any longer though. Any ideas?

It tries to submit it for a minute or so and says the content is still in sync and asks if I want to write anyways and if I say I do, it "works".

> [gitcenter](#comment_25_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Stop ZeroNet. Backup directory. Remove directory. Remove the site from users.json and sites.json (preserve the private key, though). (optional, if it doesn't work w/o this, try w/ this) Download SQLite Studio, open content.db from ZeroNet/data/content.db, find ID of site in site table, remove any site_id = {thisid} from all other tables. Restart ZeroNet. Download the site (not copy). Restore directory (or only a part, data). Sign & publish all files.

I did all of it, except from the db. I can't expect people to go through it so I might as as well deploy it fresh and see if it works.
